title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK13001 WisBlock Interface Module Overview
content: RAK13001 is a WisBlock Interface module which extends the WisBlock system to be used on isolated digital input and output applications. There is one digital output that is isolated by an electromechanical relay and one digital input isolated by an opto-couple. The isolated input can be configured as wet contact (default mode) or dry contact. RAK13001 digital output is used to programmatically switch on/off devices operating at high voltage or current applications.
parent_content: RAK13001 is a WisBlock Interface module which extends the WisBlock system to be used on isolated digital input and output applications. There is one digital output that is isolated by an electromechanical relay and one digital input isolated by an opto-couple. The isolated input can be configured as wet contact (default mode) or dry contact. RAK13001 digital output is used to programmatically switch on/off devices operating at high voltage or current applications.

title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > RAK13001 Block Diagram and Mounting Mechanics Overview
content: The overview covers the RAK13001 block diagram and the mounting mechanics of the board into the WisBlock Base board.
parent_content: The overview covers the RAK13001 block diagram and the mounting mechanics of the board into the WisBlock Base board.

title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Mounting > RAK13001 Mounting Mechanism on WisBlock Base Board
content:
The RAK13001 module can be mounted on the IO slot of the WisBlock Base board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK13001 on a WisBlock Base module, such as a RAK5005-O.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 mounting mechanism on a WisBlock Base module
parent_content:
The RAK13001 module can be mounted on the IO slot of the WisBlock Base board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK13001 on a WisBlock Base module, such as a RAK5005-O.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 mounting mechanism on a WisBlock Base module

title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Block Diagram > RAK13001 Block Diagram and Safety Precautions
content:
> **Image:** RAK13001 Block Diagram  
The RAK13001 use one relay to isolate output of MCU. The dielectric strength between coil and contacts of relay is 4000VAC 1min.  
For input, RAK13001 uses an opto-couple as isolation, and it supports wet contact as default. The rating of input is 12V-24VDC. It also can be configurated as dry contact by reworking some resistors on the PCB module.  
> **WARNING:** > **Image:** Safety Precaution
parent_content:
> **Image:** RAK13001 Block Diagram  
The RAK13001 use one relay to isolate output of MCU. The dielectric strength between coil and contacts of relay is 4000VAC 1min.  
For input, RAK13001 uses an opto-couple as isolation, and it supports wet contact as default. The rating of input is 12V-24VDC. It also can be configurated as dry contact by reworking some resistors on the PCB module.  
> **WARNING:** > **Image:** Safety Precaution

title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Chipset > Vendor and Part Number Information [TABLE]
RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK13001 WisBlock Module Pinout and Configuration [TABLE]
content:
The RAK13001 WisBlock module has a 40-pin WisConnector that is compatible to the WisBlock Base IO Slot. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 4**.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 Pinout Schematic  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- By default, PIN 10 (SW1) on WisConnector is used as DI input, and PIN 32 (IO4) is used as DO output.
- You can change DI or DO pin by reworking resistors. Some options have been reserved so you can change GPIO to control DI or DO.
parent_content:
The RAK13001 WisBlock module has a 40-pin WisConnector that is compatible to the WisBlock Base IO Slot. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 4**.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 Pinout Schematic  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- By default, PIN 10 (SW1) on WisConnector is used as DI input, and PIN 32 (IO4) is used as DO output.
- You can change DI or DO pin by reworking resistors. Some options have been reserved so you can change GPIO to control DI or DO.
- RAK13001 use 3V3_S as power. You need to open 3V3_S when using this module, and also, you can shut down 3V3_S to save power when not using this module.

title: RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > RAK13001 WisBlock Relay IO Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > Opto-coupler > RAK13001 Opto-Coupler Schematics and Dry Contact Configuration [TABLE]
content:
**Figure 10** shows opto-coupler schematics.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 Opto-coupler Schematics  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- By default, it is connected as wet contact. If you want to use dry contact mode, rework resistors on the PCB Module as follows:  
1. Remove R11 and D2;
2. Add 680Ω resistors on R9, R12, R13 ,and R14.  
- Then, short K1 and K2 can make DI to be low logical.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 PCB Silkscreen
parent_content:
**Figure 10** shows opto-coupler schematics.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 Opto-coupler Schematics  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- By default, it is connected as wet contact. If you want to use dry contact mode, rework resistors on the PCB Module as follows:  
1. Remove R11 and D2;
2. Add 680Ω resistors on R9, R12, R13 ,and R14.  
- Then, short K1 and K2 can make DI to be low logical.  
> **Image:** RAK13001 PCB Silkscreen
